channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Salesforce exec says rise of AI agents means ‘every job should be rethought’
item.description: AI agents can do tedious tasks better than people, allowing human talent to be refocused on more critical opportunities.

item.title: Boeing strikes $1.1 billion deal with Justice Department over deadly 737 Max crashes—and must pay $445 million to victims’ families
item.description: Boeing will pay and invest more than $1.1 billion, including an additional $445 million for the crash victims’ families.

item.title: Keir Starmer’s Immigration Hypocrisy
item.description: As the U.K. PM turns against open borders, people are serving time in jail for their comments about immigration.

item.title: The Week: The Antisemitic Murders in Washington
item.description: Plus: The GOP’s One Big Beautiful Bill advances.

item.title: Trump touts ‘planned partnership’ between U.S. Steel and Nippon Steel, signaling potential approval of Japanese company’s buyout bid
item.description: As recently as December, Trump said he was "totally against the once great and powerful U.S. Steel being bought by a foreign company.”

item.title: Supreme Court: President Can Fire Federal Executives Without Cause
item.description: It seems logical that a president can root out people likely to work against him and appoint people who represent his agenda.

item.title: Trump DOJ moves to dissolve Flores decree which governs detention of unaccompanied minors in the U.S.

item.title: Supreme Court Stands By While Lower Courts Carry On Ripping Up The Constitution
item.description: Until the Supreme Court acts, an unconstitutional supremacy will continue to infect even the furthest limbs of the judicial branch.

item.title: The Bond Market’s Revenge
item.description: The U.S. had been leading a global movement of fiscal irresponsibility, and now bond traders are telling everyone that time’s up.

item.title: Elon Musk’s DOGE is reportedly targeting the Census Bureau next. One expert says it’s likely to eliminate its survey about prison inmates
item.description: Researchers and users of federal data are grappling with broader concerns about the health of the U.S. statistical system.

item.title: U.S. Forces Abroad Protect the Homeland
item.description: Forward-deployed military forces impose costs on aggressive adversaries and keep violence as far from America’s shores as possible.

item.title: The Downgrade Is Done. The Investor Response Is Just Beginning
item.description: The US downgrade won’t upend markets—but it may reshape sovereign risk models and investor assumptions. Here’s what to watch next.
